#Permabanned players be like:

http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/963/073/e2d.jpg

TBH the current report/banning system is pretty shit. You people who regularly bash it have literally 0 experience with it. I do. I have been a toxic player in the past and my account was flagged, and rightly so. However, I have taken measure to reform, and they have been wildly successful. However, I still get regular punishments. In fact, I am likely a single report away from a permaban. I have literally received a 2 week time ban, a 20 game chat restriction, and a 10 game ranked restriction SIMULTANEOUSLY for saying "gg afk" ONE TIME. And before you Riot sheep say "well you can't be banned for only a single offense", BULLSHIT. Riot linked me the offensive games, and this was the only one in the log. The fact is that if you manage to get your account flagged (ie your first offense) you are fucked. Even single games can ruin you, and even if you only occasionally rage (as literally everyone does, do NOT try to say that you are some kind of pure soul that never experiences anger and allows it to show) you WILL escalate your punishment. It's not about player reform anymore, it's about removing anyone that doesn't fit in with Riot's frankly dogmatic view of social interactions.

You can't be banned for a single offense and the reason why you think that isn't true is because you clearly see "GG AFK" as your only offense. How about you give us all your chat logs and we'll see if there's anything else "hidden" in that context that you're not sharing?

Being passive-aggressive is also an offense.

I was though. This was in season 5, before the current behavioral system iteration (which now requires 3 games, or an obvious racial slur, death threat, etc). I requested the chat logs for which I was banned. The logs contained a single game, during which only one line was highlighted as toxic, and that line was "gg afk". I didn't even afk btw, so it's not like I got slapped with a leaverbuster. Also, in your effort to invalidate my voice (which is exactly how Riot wants you to respond to such protest btw), you seemed to miss a very crucial detail: a single offense earned me a 14 day time ban, a 20 game chat ban, and a 10 game ranked restriction. That penalty was cited by Riot themselves as a punishment reserved for hate speech, PLUS A CHAT AND RANKED RESTRICTION. I was literally treated worse than someone who routinely told other players to kill themselves, or threw down racial slurs regularly. If you can't see how foolish your argument against me is after this evidence, then Riot truly has corrupted your sense of justice.

>a single offense earned me a 14 day time ban, a 20 game chat ban, and a 10 game ranked restriction.

I really, really, really, really doubt this.
It depends on how serious it was but if it was all about "gg afk" once, this didn't happen.
You'd have to provide the evidence of that fact or else you can say pretty much anything and spin it however you like but it doesn't make it true. I don't believe that because this sounds extreme for basically, nothing. "gg AFK" was never punishable with a 14 day ban, 20 game chat restriction and 10 games ranked restriction, all at once.

If this was your attitude in most games you played, then it clearly shows passive-aggressive attitude towards your team when things start going bad.  Then your punishments would start accumulating from starting chat bans, then to ranked game restrictions and then (if this doesn't stop you), to 14 day ban.

I don't know what to tell you but Riot never did punish players for something they didn't do. Mistakes and oversights happen on rare occasions but if that's the case, you should always contact Riot Support and try to resolve such issues.

All I can tell you is that it really, really, really, really did happen. At least this was the only case of "toxicity" present in the chat logs provided by Riot. Is it possible that I had other games in the past year and a half since my last ban? Absolutely. But the fact is that i got  A 14 DAY TIME BAN, 10 GAME RANKED RESTRICT AND 20 GAME CHAT RESTRICT _**SIMULTANEOUSLY**_. During season 5 when this happened, the 14 day ban was reserved fairly strictly for cases of extreme verbal abuse, racial slurs/hate speech, and death threats (ie not what I did).

You know what this sounds like?
http://imgur.com/6F6LYHA
You know how stupid you look when you respond like that and downvote his post when the guy has 6 years of experience with the game over you?

It shouldn't matter how much money you spent or how many hours you have in the game, break the rules after being warned and you deserve punishment. He assumes that everyone rages, which is just not true. Get mad, sure, but I don't rage in chat. If he wants to prove that he reformed, he should post the chat logs riot gave him.
I didn't say anything about money spent.  He's got loads more experience with the game and you're here trying to say the community isn't bad, which is simply a lie.
I never said the community isn't bad? I said that not everyone flames, not "No one flames"

Fact: I was incredibly toxic during my first year.
Fact: I have reformed and now my "toxicity" is limited to only a few bad games here and there, and usually in response to other toxicity (almost exclusively trolling).
Fact: despite the fact that I am substantially less toxic, I still get banned with the same (or even possibly greater) frequency.

The problem is that once Riot flags your account (which happens after your first offense and lasts literally forever, as Riot themselves have proclaimed), you get banned for 3 offenses. Regardless of how spaced out they are. Example: my most recent reform card cited 3 games that occurred over a period of 3 months. 3 games in 3 months during which I played ~5+ games each day. Does this seem like a fair and balanced system?

Another issue is that Riot gives 0 fucks to the context of chat the ban bot deems "toxic". Example: I was once harassed extensively for playing pantheon support in a normal game, despite having literally asked the team if they were ok with it. It was clear that 4 people were going to report me for trolling, so I went into all chat to try to garner support from the enemy team and kindly asked if they would submit a report on my behalf, as I did not feel that my voice would be considered against the cries of the masses. I was banned within 5 minutes of that particular game ending, and it was cited in my reform card. So, despite me being victimized during this particular game, my chat was flagged by the ban bot as "toxic" and I was banned, even though my "toxicity" was an attempt to defend myself. Would you convict someone for fighting back against someone trying to assault them? Typically no...

Now, for the actually disturbing part: that ban occurred between the hours of 12 and 1am my time (so 9-10 rito time) on a weekend, meaning there was not a soul in Riot HQ save for possibly security or sanitation crews. This means that when Riot claims that "every case is audited by a player behavior representative" THEY ARE STRAIGHT UP FUCKING LYING. Banning is 100% automated (maybe permabans are actually audited, but I've never actually been permaed so I can't really speak to that). 

Regardless, this system is heinously unethical, and Riot relies on people like you to systematically invalidate my voice with cries of 

>it shouldn't matter how much money you spent or how many hours you have in the game, break the rules after being warned and you deserve punishment.

and the like to keep actual criticism in check. They don't care about player reform anymore, and anyone who has run afoul of the current system knows that all too well.

I have always been chat restricted-free for 3 years straight.

> However, I have taken measure to reform, and they have been wildly successful. However, I still get regular punishments.

And this shows a side where you're not being honest with us about your behavior. Just stop talking in-game.

Comms wins games. I play to win. This is not an option, nor should it EVER be encouraged by ANYONE under ANY circumstance. This is a social game, and to suggest this implies that you are anti-social. This is just the wrong kind of attitude to have in a game like this. Go play chess, you don't need teammates there.

And as for my honesty, I am being quite candid with you. I have improved my behavior dramatically. I used to tilt off the table if my team gave up first blood (hence the original flagging of my account was justified). Now, my "toxic" behavior is limited to a bad game every once in a while (and to say that you've never had a bad game effectively invalidates your opinion on this, as literally EVERYONE has bad games). The issue is, my most recent suspension cited 3 games in the reform card (which is the currently required number of games for a punishment). The three games occurred over the space of 3 months. 3 bad games in 3 months during which I played on average 5+ games a day. Do you see how ridiculous that is? Of course, you will counter this by saying "no, this is not how the system works". Well, on that note, I will cite this: 

>I have always been chat restricted-free for 3 years straight.

You know nothing about this system. You've never sent Riot a support ticket requesting info on a ban. You've never seen a reform card except for perhaps snippets of someone else's posted on these forums. You people make baseless claims without a shred of supporting information. I am giving you evidence, and literally the only thing I get in response is shit like "well clearly you're toxic". You people utterly invalidate the voices of anyone speaking out against this bullshit system with this prejudiced behavior,  which is honestly what I believe Riot intended with the way they talk about "only 5% of active accounts get punished". Ya, and what percent of ranked mains get punished I wonder? I'd bet money that it's a hell of a lot higher than 5%...
The guy you're responding to has double your time played, and you don't play ranked. You really have no ground to stand on as far as how often a long time player would have been punished.

I've stopped playing the NA account ever since the Riots's base Chicago transfer, and continued my League career in Garena. This NA account is still Leaverbustered since last year February due to bad connection, but nonetheless, never a chat restriction or suspension.

>if you get flagged just keep your interaction to simple "yes" or "no " if not just taking a break for a few days

Here's the thing, there is no way to know if your account is flagged other than by getting banned for a seemingly minor offense (ie "gg afk"). Riot refuses to be transparent with how the flagging system works, other than ensuring that once your account is flagged, it is flagged PERMANENTLY. "A few days" of good behavior makes no difference. A few months of good behavior makes little difference. One of my more recent punishments cited 3 games that were each months apart. So 3 bad games in 3 months during a time when I played as many as 5 to 10 games a day, and somehow that shows a pattern? Hell fuckin no it doesn't. The fact is that Riot literally gives 0 fucks about reforming players. You could go from cancer to a complete pleasure to play with and maintain good standing for months and still have your account flagged, and in fact, Riot has stated numerous times that they PREFER to do it this way and that this is INTENTIONAL.

Thinking that Not banning the account as a whole but taking things from it as a punishment would help if some one got reported with compounding effects for folk that get reported a lot would keep that attachment to the game through the account, but maybe that's just me.

To be fair, they do bury the cop-out that they can ban you both for any reason or without reason in a paragraph of text. 

And that, of course, allows them to ban people for what, in 2017, is considered normal behavior for online games. The ESRB has known that people are going to be jerks online for decades, and have rightfully chosen to claim for every single rating that online interactions are not rated. 

League has the strangest position as both the game with the most toxic community due to the fact there are so many players in one game and you can type either with or without hurting your own gameplay, and the game with a ban system that will punish players ruthlessly despite the much more enabling environment.
